title: Double trouble: Gaia hit by micrometeoroid and solar storm
summary: Launched in December 2013, ESA’s Gaia spacecraft is on a mission to map the locations and motions of more than a billion stars in the Milky Way with extreme precision.

title: ESA Targets 2031 for First Argonaut Lunar Lander Mission
summary: In a call for Phase A/B1 development of its Argonaut lunar lander, the European Space Agency revealed that it is targeting 2031 for the lander’s first mission to the Moon’s surface. Funding for the development of the Argonaut lunar lander was approved by ESA member states during the agency’s ministerial council meeting in November 2022. […]

title: Second SLS core stage ready to ship to Florida
summary: NASA rolled out the second core stage for the Space Launch System rocket July 16 to ship it to Florida for the Artemis 2 mission next year.

title: NASA space technology head leaves the agency
summary: The head of NASA’s space technology directorate is leaving the agency after just six months on the job and will be replaced on an interim basis by the director of the Langley Research Center.

title: Discovery Alert: With Six New Worlds, 5,500 Discovery Milestone Passed!
summary: On Aug. 24, 2023, more than three decades after the first confirmation of planets beyond our own solar system, scientists announced the discovery of six new exoplanets, stretching that number to 5,502. From zero exoplanet confirmations to over 5,500 in just a few decades, this new milestone marks another major step in the journey to […]

title: NASA science head optimistic Europa Clipper launches on schedule
summary: The head of NASA’s science directorate says she remains optimistic the Europa Clipper mission will launch on schedule in October despite concerns about the spacecraft’s electronics and its launch vehicle.

title: NASA Invites Media to Discuss Exploration Science Program Update
summary: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 4 p.m. EDT, Wednesday, July 17, to provide an update on a program within NASA’s Exploration Science Strategy and Integration Office. Audio of the teleconference will stream live on the agency’s website at: https://www.nasa.gov/nasatv Participants in the teleconference include: To ask questions during the teleconference, media must RSVP […]

title: NASA Ships Moon Rocket Stage Ahead of First Crewed Artemis Flight
summary: NASA rolled out the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket’s core stage for the Artemis II test flight from its manufacturing facility in New Orleans on Tuesday for shipment to the agency’s spaceport in Florida. The rollout is key progress on the path to NASA’s first crewed mission to the Moon under the Artemis campaign. Using […]

title: NASA Deputy Administrator Holds First Bilateral Engagement with KASA
summary: NASA Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy conducted the first bilateral meeting on Monday with Dr. Young-bin Yoon, administrator of the newly established KASA (Korea AeroSpace Administration), which opened on May 27. The creation of KASA underscores the Republic of Korea’s commitment to advancing space exploration. The bilateral meeting marks a pivotal moment for a NASA’s relationship […]

title: Elon Announces SpaceX HQ Leaving California, Moving To Texas
summary: Elon Announces SpaceX HQ Leaving California, Moving To Texas
